glsa.title: zgv, xzgv: Heap overflow
glsa.synopsis: xzgv and zgv attempt to decode JPEG images within the CMYK/YCCK colour space incorrectly, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: xzgv and zgv are picture viewing utilities with a thumbnail based file selector.

description.p: Andrea Barisani of Gentoo Linux discovered xzgv and zgv allocate insufficient memory when rendering images with more than 3 output components, such as images using the YCCK or CMYK colour space. When xzgv or zgv attempt to render the image, data from the image overruns a heap allocated buffer.

impact.p: An attacker may be able to construct a malicious image that executes arbitrary code with the permissions of the xzgv or zgv user when attempting to render the image.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
